etymologies: early 19th century. From Arabic sanṭ (also ṣanṭ), collective noun from Coptic šonte, šanti, etc. from ancient Egyptian šnḏt, šntt thorn tree

definitions: An acacia tree native to North Africa and parts of Asia, Acacia nilotica, which is used as a source of gum arabic and of timber; also called babul. Also: the wood of this tree. Frequently attributive, especially in "sunt tree".
